rev.comment: added disputed tag, reworked phrasing, attributed opinion
Date/fix the maintenance tags or gen fixes using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* History */ original research synthesis, particularly claims such as "such an interpretation is implausible because..." etc. See also [[WP:NPOV]]
Reverting blatant [[WP:FRINGE]] violation by [[WP:SPA]]. See [[User_talk:Childhoodsend#Imagine_this.]] Also. "famous" and "Austrian adherents" are POV.
re-add deleted para that cannot be seriously challenged
OR and POVed (also note that the article starts with a mention that AE are heterodox)
Removing unnecessary "fact" tag, but adding "historically" caveat.
Stuff blatantly violating Wikipedia policy removed. See [[User_talk:Skomorokh#On_Austrian_economics]].
added citations for disputed material, pro and con
[[Neoclassical economics]] is mainstream. See [[mainstream economics]]. A Neoclassical economist's paper on a university website does not violate [[WP:FRINGE]].
restore consensus version. Fringe is not at issue unless contrdicting non-fringe sources are provided. Attributed claims and tagged statements
This is a policy issue. It has nothing to do with my particular political beliefs. See [[WP:FRINGE]].

Anononymous IP violation of [[WP:NOR]], [[WP:NPOV]] and [[WP:FRINGE]]. Warning issued. See [[User talk:68.187.244.20]].
Revert. Calling a political philosophy a "pseudoscience" is one of the most egregious POV violations I have ever seen.
Please preserve information. The criticism was all removed by anonymous IPs. See http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Austrian_School&diff=180928817&oldid=179542237
Removing mostly uncited [[WP:NOR|Original research]]. Boettke isn't a respected economist. He's [[WP:FRINGE|fringe]] also.
removed "Steven P. Spadijer", the name of a child in my school, not an economist

reisman is not an austrian see: www.gmu.edu/rae/archives/VOL12_1_1999/kirzner.pdf

That was pretty clearly a typo for "root". Market processes as opposed equilibria are a pretty significant underlying distinction.
/* History */ 1st para., end: , ..:“Psych. Sch.,” “Vienna Sch,” or “Austrian School,”<fn>Israel M. Kirzner (1987)."Austr School of Economics,"[[New Palgrave: A Dictionary of Economics]], v. 145-51.
/* History */1st para., end: , ..:“Psych. Sch.,” “Vienna Sch,” or “Austrian School,”<fn>Israel M. Kirzner (1987)."Austr School of Economics,"'[[New Palgrave: A Dictionary of Economics]], v. 145-51.
/* Critical */ this page that I removed does not represent a serius criticism of austrian economics
Plenty of authoritative sources simply say outright that Austrian economics is in fact heterodox. See talk page for further details and cites. This isn't even worth referencing.
Direct quote from source. Until you can find a source that says the consensus view is that it is heterodox, then you are unjustified in stating as a matter of fact that it is.
It is a true statement that "some people believe the Earth is flat". This is nevertheless irrelevant; the consensus view is that Austrian economics is currently heterodox.
If the source says some think it's mainstream and some think it is not, then you're choosing one opinion over the other. It can't be said with certainty that it's "heterodox."
The latter is by far the minority. Note listings in [[Heterodox economics]]; if Austrian economics were mainstream, there'd be more than 2 Austrian uni econ departments. See talk page for more.
If the source says some consider it mainstream and some consider it radical, then you can't state that it's heterodox. That would be called "POV" on your part.
Why delete the only referenced information in this section?
Note contributions of Austrian economics to mainstream economics in introduction.
Heterodoxy. Boettke is neither a neutral or even a consistent source here. See talk page. The methodology is completely antithetical to the mainstream, and Austrian papers aren't published there.
correct reference to "Why We Can't Associate Too closely with the Austrians"
There's difference of opinion whether it's mainstream of not.

punc: emdashes are used for interjections, endashes are used for numerical ranges, etc.
[[Heterodox economics]] explicitly lists Austrian economics. See talk page for more. Additionally, modern neoclassical economics no longer uses cardinal utility.
according to the [[Mainstream economics]] article, Austrian Econ. isn't considered entirely "heterodox"
noting that austrian economics is in fact heterodox
